CalculateArrowAngle(Point, Point, PortPosition?, double)

Calculates the arrow angle using a hybrid approach that combines port position (logical direction) with path geometry (visual direction) for consistent, accurate arrow rendering.

public static double CalculateArrowAngle(Point tip, Point fromPoint, PortPosition? targetPortPosition = null, double angleThreshold = 0.7853981633974483)

Parameters

tip Point

The arrow tip point (target position).

fromPoint Point

The point the edge comes from (preceding the tip).

targetPortPosition PortPosition?

Optional port position for logical direction hint.

angleThreshold double

Angle tolerance in radians for preferring port direction (default: π/4 = 45°).

Returns

double

The angle in radians for the arrow direction.

Remarks

This method implements a hybrid approach: 1. If port position is provided, get the expected angle from port side 2. Calculate the actual segment angle from path geometry 3. If segment angle is within threshold of expected, use port direction (cleaner) 4. Otherwise, use actual segment direction (handles unusual routing)

This ensures consistency between custom renderers and default rendering while handling edge cases like curved paths or unusual node arrangements.

CreateArrowMarker(Point, double, double, bool)

Creates an arrow marker geometry at the specified point.

public static PathGeometry CreateArrowMarker(Point point, double angle, double size = 10, bool closed = false)

Parameters

point Point

The tip of the arrow.

angle double

The angle of the arrow in radians (0 = pointing right).

size double

The size of the arrow.

closed bool

If true, creates a filled triangle; if false, creates open arrow lines.

Returns

PathGeometry
